consecutiveDatesYearFraction Description ———– For given sequence of dates returns arr of list year fractions with edges T_i-1 and T_i

setSchedule(effectiveDate: DT, terminationDate: DT, tenor: Period, calendar: Calendar, convention=0, end_simulation_date_convention=0, rule: DateGeneration = 1, endOfMonth: bool = False) → Schedule[source]

Description

Method creates the schedule that handle with life cycle of a trade. The heart of the class.

param effectiveDate:

Date on which we valuate the contract

type effectiveDate:

DT

param terminationDate:

Date when contract terminates.

type terminationDate:

DT

param tenor:

interval between two adjacent dates

type tenor:

ql.Period

param calendar:

Set of rules that defines bank holidays according to chosen country.

type calendar:

ql.Calendar

param convention:

Convention how to adjust non-working day, by default QuantLibToolKit.setDateCorrectionsSchema()

type convention:

int, optional

param end_simulation_date_convention:

_description_, by default QuantLibToolKit.setDateCorrectionsSchema()

type end_simulation_date_convention:

_type_, optional

param rule:

_description_, by default QuantLibToolKit.setRuleOfDateGeneration()

type rule:

ql.DateGeneration, optional

param endOfMonth:

_description_, by default False

type endOfMonth:

bool, optional

rtype:

ql.Schedule

setYearFractionConvention(year_fraction_conv: str = 'Actual365') → QL[source]

Description

Function defines how we will calculate year fraction.

param year_fraction_conv:

Available alternatives: Actual360, Actual365, ActualActual, Thirty360, Business252

type year_fraction_conv:

string

rtype:

ql.FractionConvention

eulerDiscretisationSchema(simulation_dates: List[DT], simulation_grid: List[float], paths_number: int = 1000) → array[source]

Description

This function creates numpy array that represents modelled equity prices using Euler discretization schema.

param path_number:

number os scenarios, by default 1000

type path_number:

int, optional

returns:

array representing scenarios along defined timestep calendar. Rows represent simulation grid, column

rtype:

numpy arr
